==Events==
* [[238]] &ndash; [[Gordian I]] and his son [[Gordian II]] are proclaimed [[Roman Emperor]]s.
* [[871]] &ndash; [[Æthelred of Wessex]] defeats a Danish invasion army at the [[Battle of Marton]].
*[[1508]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand II of Aragon]] commissions [[Amerigo Vespucci]] chief navigator of the [[Spanish Empire]].
*[[1621]] &ndash; The [[Pilgrim (Plymouth Colony)|Pilgrims]] of [[Plymouth Colony]] sign a peace treaty with [[Massasoit]] of the [[Wampanoag (tribe)|Wampanoags]].
*[[1622]] &ndash; [[Indian massacre of 1622|Jamestown massacre]]: [[Algonquian peoples|Algonquian]] Indians kill 347 [[England|English]] settlers around [[Jamestown, Virginia]], a third of the colony's population, during the [[Anglo-Powhatan Wars|Second Anglo-Powhatan War]].
*[[1630]] &ndash; The [[Massachusetts Bay Colony]] outlaws the possession of cards, [[dice]], and gaming tables.
*[[1638]] &ndash; [[Anne Hutchinson]] is expelled from Massachusetts Bay Colony for religious dissent.
*[[1713]] &ndash; The [[Tuscarora War]] comes to an end with the fall of [[Fort Neoheroka]], effectively opening up the interior of [[North Carolina]] to European colonization.
*[[1739]] &ndash; [[Nadir Shah]] occupies [[Delhi]] in [[India]] and sacks the city, stealing the jewels of the [[Peacock Throne]].
*[[1765]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of Great Britain|British Parliament]] passes the [[Stamp Act 1765|Stamp Act]] that introduces a tax to be levied directly on its [[British colonization of the Americas|American colonies]].
*[[1784]] &ndash; The [[Emerald Buddha]] is moved with great ceremony to its current location in [[Wat Phra Kaew]], [[Thailand]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; In the [[London Protocol (1829)|London Protocol]], the three protecting powers ([[United Kingdom]], [[Bourbon Restoration|France]] and [[Russian Empire|Russia]]) establish the borders of [[Greece]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; The [[Austrian Empire|Austrians]] defeat the [[Kingdom of Sardinia|Piedmontese]] at the [[Battle of Novara (1849)|Battle of Novara]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; In [[North Carolina]], [[William Woods Holden]] becomes the first [[Governor (United States)|governor]] of a [[U.S. state]] to be removed from office by [[impeachment]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; [[Illinois]] becomes the first state to require sexual equality in employment
*[[1873]] &ndash; A law is approved by the Spanish National Assembly in [[Puerto Rico]] to abolish [[slavery]].
*[[1894]] &ndash; The first playoff game for the [[Stanley Cup]] starts.
*[[1906]] &ndash; The first England vs France rugby union match is played at [[Parc des Princes]] in Paris
*[[1916]] &ndash; The last [[Emperor of China]], [[Yuan Shikai]], abdicates the throne and the [[Republic of China]] is restored.
*[[1920]] &ndash; Azeri and Turkish army soldiers with participation of Kurdish gangs [[Shushi Massacres|attacked]] the Armenian inhabitants of Shushi (Nagorno Karabakh).
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Germany]] takes [[Klaipėda Region|Memel]] from [[Lithuania]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: In the [[Mediterranean Sea]], the [[Royal Navy]] confronts Italy's [[Regia Marina]] in the [[Second Battle of Sirte]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: the entire population of [[Khatyn massacre|Khatyn]] in [[Belarus]] is burnt alive by [[Germany|German]] occupation forces.
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Arab League]] is founded when a charter is adopted in [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; Closed since [[1939]], the [[London bullion market]] reopens.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Arthur Leonard Schawlow]] and [[Charles Hard Townes]] receive the first [[patent]] for a [[laser]]
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[The Beatles]]{{'}} first album, ''[[Please Please Me]]'', is released in the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; The United States Congress sends the [[Equal Rights Amendment]] to the states for ratification.
*  1972   &ndash; In [[Eisenstadt v. Baird]], the United States Supreme Court decides that unmarried persons have the right to possess contraceptives.
*[[1975]] &ndash; A fire at the [[Browns Ferry Nuclear Power Plant]] in [[Decatur, Alabama]] causes a dangerous reduction in cooling water levels.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Karl Wallenda]] of [[The Flying Wallendas]] dies after falling off a tight-rope between two hotels in [[San Juan, Puerto Rico]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[NASA]]'s [[Space Shuttle]] ''[[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]'', is launched from the [[Kennedy Space Center]] on its third mission, [[STS-3]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; Teachers at the [[McMartin preschool trial|McMartin preschool]] in [[Manhattan Beach, California]] are charged with [[satanic ritual abuse]] of the children in the school. The charges are later dropped as completely unfounded.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Clint Malarchuk]] of the [[Buffalo Sabres]] suffers a near-fatal injury when another player's skate accidentally slits his throat.
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[USAir Flight 405]] crashes shortly after takeoff from [[New York City]]'s [[LaGuardia Airport]], leading to a number of studies into the effect that ice has on aircraft.
*  1992   &ndash; [[Fall of communism in Albania]]: The [[Democratic Party of Albania]] wins a decisive majority in the [[Albanian parliamentary election, 1992|parliamentary election]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; The [[Intel Corporation]] ships the first [[Pentium (brand)|Pentium]] chips (80586), featuring a 60 MHz clock speed, 100+ [[Instructions per second|MIPS]], and a 64 bit data path.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Astronaut|Cosmonaut]] [[Valeriy Polyakov]] returns to earth after setting a record of 438 days in [[outer space|space]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Tara Lipinski]], age 14 years and 10 months, becomes the youngest champion women's [[World Figure Skating Championships|World Figure Skating Champion]].
*  1997   &ndash; The [[Comet Hale-Bopp]] has its closest approach to [[Earth]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Ahmed Yassin]], co-founder and leader of the [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] [[Sunni]] Islamist group [[Hamas]], two bodyguards, and nine civilian bystanders are killed in the [[Gaza Strip]] when hit by [[Israeli Air Force]] [[AH-64 Apache]] fired [[AGM-114 Hellfire|Hellfire missiles]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; Three [[Christian Peacemaker Team]] hostages are freed by British forces in [[Baghdad]] after 118 days of captivity and the murder of their colleague, American [[Tom Fox (activist)|Tom Fox]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 37 people are killed and 200 are injured after a [[2013 Thailand refugee camp fire|fire destroys]] a camp containing [[Burma|Burmese]] [[refugees]] near [[Ban Mae]], [[Thailand]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; At least 35 people die in [[Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]], in a [[Hub bus-tanker crash|collision]] between a petrol tanker and two buses.
*  2014   &ndash; At least 36 people are killed and 10 others missing in a [[2014 Oso mudslide|mudslide]] in [[Oso, Washington]].
